Yeah. This is an advertisment. It's actually a relevent post, but it should=
 have been more clearly identified as a commercially related post, perhaps =
with an [ANNOUNCE] prefix in the header line.

That being said, David McCaw=
 used to be our account rep and we were very happy with him and his product=
 before he got shuffled internally to other accounts.

Simon

>
>> Just wanted to let everybody know that the lat=
est version of Jtest!
>> is completely compatible with JUnit.  JTest can lo=
ad and execute all
>> of your existing JUnit test classes.  It can export i=
ts automatically
>> generated test cases into a test class.  It can also cr=
eate a test
>> class template when you wish to define your own test class.
=
>>
>> In addition to all the functionality you find in JUnit, JTest will
>>=
 automatically generate test cases to test the construction of a class
>> (=
assuring you that there is no unexpected input that will cause a
>> method =
to throw an exception).  The tool also does static-analysis
>> (automatic e=
nforcement of best coding practices), regression testing,
>> coverage analy=
sis (for both JUnit and Jtest generated test classes),
>> and checks Design=
 By Contract.
>>
>> If anybody is interested in seeing a demo, please conta=
ct me as I
>> will be scheduling several over the next few weeks.
>>
>> You=
 can reach me at:
>>
>> dmccaw@...
>> 888-305-0041 x1209
>>
>> For=
 more info, visit http://www.parasoft.com.
>>
>> Thanks,
>> David McCaw
>>
